<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/morgan-stanley-acquire-etrade-13-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Morgan StanlE-Trade. Just a Suggestion.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Morgan Stanley skyscraper on Main St. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1582237149.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Morgan Stanley skyscraper on Main St. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1582237149.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Morgan Stanley <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-e-trade-financl-m-a-morgan-stanley/morgan-stanleys-gorman-charts-ambitious-course-with-13-billion-etrade-deal-idUSKBN20E1P4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced it’s buying</a> online brokerage E-Trade in a $13 billion, all-stock deal that’s Wall Street’s biggest takeover since the 2008 financial crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The prize:</strong> E-Trade’s 5.2 million customers and $360 billion in assets, including $56 billion in deposits it can use as funding. And top billing in the Brew, obviously. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Conditions were ripe </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that Morgan Stanley has overcome Heartbreak Hill on its recession recovery marathon, it's looking for steadier revenue streams than its investment banking and trading divisions can offer. CEO James Gorman has been stalking E-Trade for years—first in 2002 at Merrill Lynch, then in 2007 at Morgan Stanley. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Talks rekindled in December as E-Trade pondered its fate following news that brokerage rivals Charles Schwab and TD Ameritrade </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/schwabs-deal-td-ameritrade-invites-antitrust-scrutiny?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were combining</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>All three brokerages were hurting from falling commissions and low interest rates.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Noticing more banking deals? Wall Street is taking advantage of the Trump administration’s friendlier attitude to financial takeovers.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">From Wall St. to Main St. </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, wealth management <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/morgan-stanley-is-buying-e-trade-betting-on-littler-customers-11582201440?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accounted for more than half</a> of Morgan Stanley’s record $41 billion in revenue. Its 15k-strong human advisors traditionally focused on the 0.1%, but last year, MS opened up an online tool for customers who can file on TurboTax. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The E-Trade acquisition will expand that division, and execs said it would give Morgan Stanley the ability to offer more regular-guy services like checking and savings. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gorman also hopes to leverage E-Trade to expand wealth management services to international customers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And don’t forget about E-Trade’s primary engine: managing compensation-related stock. The combined companies will control $580+ billion in employee shares across 4,000 corporate customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>“All of Wall Street is on the hunt for more reliable sources of revenue after postcrisis regulations and a long period of eerie calm in the markets crimped trading,” writes the WSJ. JPMorgan and Bank of America are doubling down on payments, while Goldman Sachs is leaning into retail banking.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/wexner-steps-sycamore-taking-majority-stake-victorias-secret?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wexner Takes the L
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Victoria's Secret wings " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMjM2ODgzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, CEO and Chairman of L Brands Les Wexner hit us with <a href="https://apnews.com/d00ca1487737d4c28f2e239e6d4d3a09?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a double whammy</a>.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After almost six decades in charge, Wexner will step down from his leadership roles at L Brands (though he’ll stay on the board). Wexner was the longest-serving CEO of an S&P 500 company; now, that's Warren Buffett. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Private equity firm Sycamore Partners will pay $525 million for a 55% stake in L Brands’s Victoria’s Secret. Sycamore is known for </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1fa945ae-5995-11e9-9dde-7aedca0a081a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brass-knuckle tactics</a></span><span> that get results in a moribund U.S. retail market. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The deal reportedly values VS at $1.1 billion, a humiliating number for a company that did about $7 billion in revenue last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>L Brands is crumbling under a $5.5 billion debt pile and plunging sales at VS. It will use the funds from the partial VS sale to start paying that bill down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pressure was also mounting over Wexner’s connection to the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. Epstein’s suicide last August while in jail facing sex trafficking charges drew attention to Wexner’s status as Epstein’s only publicly known client.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>+ <strong style="color:#000">In case you're wondering...</strong>moribund (adj.): <span>No longer effective and about to come to an end completely. </span></em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/viacomcbs-expects-16m-access-subscribers-2019?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Rising Stream Lifts All Boats
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In its first post-merger earnings call, ViacomCBS said it expects <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/20/21144199/cbs-streaming-service-all-access-price-house-of-brands-live-news-sports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">16 million combined subscribers</a> across streaming platforms Showtime and CBS All Access by the end of 2020. All Access launched in 2014, but failed to get half the traction in six years that Disney+ gained in its first four months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, CEO Bob Bakish revealed his “House of Brands” strategy—a plan to put All Access on the Dwayne Johnson diet. Bakish said the revamped service will have "30,000 episodes of TV and up to 1,000 movies" from brands like MTV and Comedy Central.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>ViacomCBS has read the headlines. Last year, 5.5 million paying customers <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cord-cutting-accelerates-raising-pressure-on-cable-providers-11582149209?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut their cords</a> to major cable and satellite TV companies, a more than 70% acceleration over 2018.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why the uptick? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Programming costs are rising, and TV providers are passing them on to consumers, the WSJ reports. A lot of those costs come from live news and sports, which is ironic because that’s the only content keeping customers </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/future-sports-live-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tethered to cable</a></span><span> in the first place. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, NBA Commissioner Adam Silver said the league’s never been more popular online, but also never had </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/richlightshed/status/1230519843910307843?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more difficulty</a></span><span> getting young viewers to tune in to broadcasts. </span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F20%2Fviacomcbs-expects-16m-access-subscribers-2019" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/kpop-sensation-bts-releases-latest-album?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
BTS Is Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="BTS music video " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cJYZXbyN4mO3fEnKze/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="BTS music video " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cJYZXbyN4mO3fEnKze/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Many have tried to break the internet. </strong>Many have failed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But today, we like BTS’s chances. The South Korean pop band is releasing its latest album, <em>Map of the Soul: 7</em>, and scientists warn it will likely rip the Earth right out of orbit. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is fandom like we’ve never seen...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In three October 2019 concerts in Seoul, BTS created a </span><span><a href="http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20191223000424&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">total economic effect</a></span><span> worth $861 million, per researchers at Korea University. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>BTS contributes $4.7 billion to South Korea’s GDP, on par with Samsung and Hyundai. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The band has a more engaged following on Twitter than any other entity by far, </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/bts-kpop-twitter-media-5a613c2f-f706-4a77-be74-03c0e1377533.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosfutureofwork&stream=future&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios</a></span><span>. It got almost 4x the engagement of President Trump in early 2019, per CrowdTangle. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Map of the Soul: 7 </em>is already the <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/hughmcintyre/2020/02/18/btss-map-of-the-soul-7-is-now-the-most-preordered-south-korean-album-of-all-time/#1da2b3da73de?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most preordered</a> South Korean album of all time. And as the Brew’s K-Pop correspondent Jamie Wilde mentioned, “They’ll probably break six more music industry records” today.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F20%2Fkpop-sensation-bts-releases-latest-album" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Map+of+the+Soul%3A+7+is+already+the+most+preordered+South+Korean+album+of+all+time&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/kpop-sensation-bts-releases-latest-album&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F20%2Fkpop-sensation-bts-releases-latest-album&title=K-Pop+Sensation+BTS+Releases+Latest+Album&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Map+of+the+Soul%3A+7+is+already+the+most+preordered+South+Korean+album+of+all+time" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We love to learn. And even though we’ve achieved meteoric newsletter fame according to our grandma, we know there is more we can be doing to further our lauded, illustrious, email-centric careers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve turned to <a href="https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flinkedin-learning.pxf.io%2Fc%2F2073445%2F449670%2F8005&data=02%7C01%7Cashukert%40linkedin.com%7Ce5ddbee8f530455eed3008d7b4d96aef%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637176718210587223&sdata=SVasschOTw3%2BcYDIDwAIR8tR5c%2FU116rM%2FmpHMsOePg%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LinkedIn Learning</a> to achieve our goals. With <strong style="color:#000">access to 15,000+ expert-led courses in business, tech, and creative, </strong>we are becoming bona fide geniuses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And whether you’re at our level (Chief Wittiness Officer) or a bit further down the rungs, <a href="https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flinkedin-learning.pxf.io%2Fc%2F2073445%2F449670%2F8005&data=02%7C01%7Cashukert%40linkedin.com%7Ce5ddbee8f530455eed3008d7b4d96aef%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637176718210597215&sdata=%2FjAz1FItQPf2pW%2Fv2z%2FuwfJlkWDHIdro4F9PYrfYdWQ%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LinkedIn Learning</a> offers in-demand online courses to help you achieve your professional goals at each stage of your career.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Learn on your time, with bite-sized videos or in-depth online courses taught by real-world expert instructors</strong>. It’s not one-size-fits-all education—<a href="https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flinkedin-learning.pxf.io%2Fc%2F2073445%2F449670%2F8005&data=02%7C01%7Cashukert%40linkedin.com%7Ce5ddbee8f530455eed3008d7b4d96aef%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637176718210597215&sdata=%2FjAz1FItQPf2pW%2Fv2z%2FuwfJlkWDHIdro4F9PYrfYdWQ%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LinkedIn Learning</a> offers personalized online course recommendations based on your needs and goals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once you complete a course, you’ll be able to add a certificate to your LinkedIn Profile. Your Mimi will be proud. Your company will be better for it. Your business IQ will hit meteoric levels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flinkedin-learning.pxf.io%2Fc%2F2073445%2F449670%2F8005&data=02%7C01%7Cashukert%40linkedin.com%7Ce5ddbee8f530455eed3008d7b4d96aef%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637176718210607209&sdata=usYitmxqyVQ4CIVMDMLD6BHjVftRnb0P2XZwjPKd5Pc%3D&reserved=0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try LinkedIn Learning today</a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/dominos-stock-skyrockets-blowout-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Domino’s Earnings: Like a Slice Oozing With Alfredo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Domino’s reported <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-dominos-pizza-results/dominos-shares-hit-new-high-on-first-u-s-same-store-sales-beat-in-a-year-idUSKBN20E1OU?feedType=RSS&feedName=businessNews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">greasy numbers</a> for Q4 2019. It beat Wall Street estimates on net income ($129 million), revenue ($1.2 billion), and same-store sales growth (3.4%). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Same-store sales = sales at locations that have been operating for at least a year. It’s a key metric in retail, since it measures a firm’s ability to grow revenue for existing assets. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it baked this money pie: </strong>Domino’s invested in new stores and menu items, speedy delivery times, and its online operations. For the entire week of Cyber Monday, it offered half off menu-priced pizzas for online orders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s the opposite of a silver lining? </strong>For Domino’s it was international same-store sales growth, which missed estimates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Domino’s is facing a tough market, with newer entrants like DoorDash and UberEats <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/20/dominos-pizza-dpz-earnings-q4-2019-beat-wall-street-estimates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scooping up</a> impulsive dinner orderers. But Domino’s shares outperformed both McDonald’s and Yum Brands (which owns rival Pizza Hut) in 2019. And they shot up another 26% yesterday. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/brews-weekly-news-quiz-february-21?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Feel Quizzy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Underwhelmed by our conversations with Elon Musk tbh. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Which country is one quarter of negative GDP growth away from a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/17/japan-looks-like-headed-recession?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recession</a>? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2.<strong style="color:#000"> Circle one:</strong></p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The first commercial space tourism company to </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/virgin-galactic-shares-soar-thanks-retail-investors?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a></span><span>: Virgin Galactic or SpaceX</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The first white-collar tech employees </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/kickstarter-employees-join-tech-industrys-first-union?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to unionize</a></span><span>: Airbnb or Kickstarter</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The first Arab country to build a nuclear power plant: UAE or Qatar</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3.<strong style="color:#000"> Fill in the blank:</strong> A “________” is a school bus converted into a mobile living space. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. According to the U.S. Department of Transportation’s report on air travel, which airline was the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/19/cancellations-delays-governments-annual-report-air-travel?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most punctual</a> in 2019? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>What is the name of Jeff Bezos’s $10 billion initiative to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/17/jeff-bezos-pledges-10-billion-tackling-climate-change?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fund efforts</a> tackling climate change?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon Climate Clean Up </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bezos Earth Fund</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jeff Bezos Climate Action Fund</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Morning Brezos</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers: </strong>1. Japan 2. a. Virgin Galactic b. Kickstarter c. UAE 3. Skoolie 4. Hawaiian Airlines 5. Bezos Earth Fund</em></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/20/media/hbo-max-youtube-tv/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WarnerMedia</a></span><span>’s streaming service HBO Max will be available on YouTube TV, per a new deal announced yesterday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/85eb16d097d710df31890137f136d5c3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">USC</a></span><span> said it will introduce free tuition for undergrads with families making under $80,000/year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-20/in-america-s-richest-town-500k-a-year-is-now-below-average?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Atherton, CA</a></span><span>, is the richest town in America, according to Bloomberg. You may not be surprised to hear it’s a Silicon Valley suburb.</span>
</li>

Just a Suggestion.\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Morgan Stanley skyscraper on Main St. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1582237149.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Morgan Stanley skyscraper on Main St. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1582237149.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Morgan Stanley \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-e-trade-financl-m-a-morgan-stanley/morgan-stanleys-gorman-charts-ambitious-course-with-13-billion-etrade-deal-idUSKBN20E1P4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced it’s buying\u003c/a\u003e online brokerage E-Trade in a $13 billion, all-stock deal that’s Wall Street’s biggest takeover since the 2008 financial crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe prize:\u003c/strong\u003e E-Trade’s 5.2 million customers and $360 billion in assets, including $56 billion in deposits it can use as funding. And top billing in the Brew, obviously. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eConditions were ripe \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that Morgan Stanley has overcome Heartbreak Hill on its recession recovery marathon, it's looking for steadier revenue streams than its investment banking and trading divisions can offer. CEO James Gorman has been stalking E-Trade for years—first in 2002 at Merrill Lynch, then in 2007 at Morgan Stanley. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTalks rekindled in December as E-Trade pondered its fate following news that brokerage rivals Charles Schwab and TD Ameritrade \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/25/schwabs-deal-td-ameritrade-invites-antitrust-scrutiny?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere combining\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAll three brokerages were hurting from falling commissions and low interest rates.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNoticing more banking deals? Wall Street is taking advantage of the Trump administration’s friendlier attitude to financial takeovers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFrom Wall St. to Main St. \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, wealth management \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/morgan-stanley-is-buying-e-trade-betting-on-littler-customers-11582201440?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccounted for more than half\u003c/a\u003e of Morgan Stanley’s record $41 billion in revenue. Its 15k-strong human advisors traditionally focused on the 0.1%, but last year, MS opened up an online tool for customers who can file on TurboTax. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe E-Trade acquisition will expand that division, and execs said it would give Morgan Stanley the ability to offer more regular-guy services like checking and savings. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGorman also hopes to leverage E-Trade to expand wealth management services to international customers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd don’t forget about E-Trade’s primary engine: managing compensation-related stock. The combined companies will control $580+ billion in employee shares across 4,000 corporate customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003e“All of Wall Street is on the hunt for more reliable sources of revenue after postcrisis regulations and a long period of eerie calm in the markets crimped trading,” writes the WSJ. JPMorgan and Bank of America are doubling down on payments, while Goldman Sachs is leaning into retail banking.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, CEO and Chairman of L Brands Les Wexner hit us with \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d00ca1487737d4c28f2e239e6d4d3a09?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea double whammy\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter almost six decades in charge, Wexner will step down from his leadership roles at L Brands (though he’ll stay on the board). Wexner was the longest-serving CEO of an S\u0026P 500 company; now, that's Warren Buffett. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePrivate equity firm Sycamore Partners will pay $525 million for a 55% stake in L Brands’s Victoria’s Secret. Sycamore is known for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/1fa945ae-5995-11e9-9dde-7aedca0a081a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrass-knuckle tactics\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that get results in a moribund U.S. retail market. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe deal reportedly values VS at $1.1 billion, a humiliating number for a company that did about $7 billion in revenue last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eL Brands is crumbling under a $5.5 billion debt pile and plunging sales at VS. It will use the funds from the partial VS sale to start paying that bill down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePressure was also mounting over Wexner’s connection to the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. Epstein’s suicide last August while in jail facing sex trafficking charges drew attention to Wexner’s status as Epstein’s only publicly known client.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn its first post-merger earnings call, ViacomCBS said it expects \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/20/21144199/cbs-streaming-service-all-access-price-house-of-brands-live-news-sports?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" All Access launched in 2014, but failed to get half the traction in six years that Disney+ gained in its first four months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, CEO Bob Bakish revealed his “House of Brands” strategy—a plan to put All Access on the Dwayne Johnson diet. Bakish said the revamped service will have \"30,000 episodes of TV and up to 1,000 movies\" from brands like MTV and Comedy Central.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eViacomCBS has read the headlines. Last year, 5.5 million paying customers \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cord-cutting-accelerates-raising-pressure-on-cable-providers-11582149209?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut their cords\u003c/a\u003e to major cable and satellite TV companies, a more than 70% acceleration over 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy the uptick? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eProgramming costs are rising, and TV providers are passing them on to consumers, the WSJ reports. A lot of those costs come from live news and sports, which is ironic because that’s the only content keeping customers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/14/future-sports-live-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etethered to cable\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the first place. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, NBA Commissioner Adam Silver said the league’s never been more popular online, but also never had \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/richlightshed/status/1230519843910307843?s=12\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore difficulty\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e getting young viewers to tune in to The South Korean pop band is releasing its latest album, \u003cem\u003eMap of the Soul: 7\u003c/em\u003e, and scientists warn it will likely rip the Earth right out of orbit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is fandom like we’ve never seen...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn three October 2019 concerts in Seoul, BTS created a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20191223000424\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etotal economic effect\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e worth $861 million, per researchers at Korea University. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBTS contributes $4.7 billion to South Korea’s GDP, on par with Samsung and Hyundai. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe band has a more engaged following on Twitter than any other entity by far, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/bts-kpop-twitter-media-5a613c2f-f706-4a77-be74-03c0e1377533.html?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosfutureofwork\u0026stream=future\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Axios\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. It got almost 4x the engagement of President Trump in early 2019, per CrowdTangle. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eMap of the Soul: 7 \u003c/em\u003eis already the \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/hughmcintyre/2020/02/18/btss-map-of-the-soul-7-is-now-the-most-preordered-south-korean-album-of-all-time/#1da2b3da73de?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost preordered\u003c/a\u003e South Korean album of all time. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Domino’s reported \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-dominos-pizza-results/dominos-shares-hit-new-high-on-first-u-s-same-store-sales-beat-in-a-year-idUSKBN20E1OU?feedType=RSS\u0026feedName=businessNews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egreasy numbers\u003c/a\u003e for Q4 2019. It beat Wall Street estimates on net income ($129 million), revenue ($1.2 billion), and same-store sales growth (3.4%). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSame-store sales = sales at locations that have been operating for at least a year. It’s a key metric in retail, since it measures a firm’s ability to grow revenue for existing assets. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it baked this money pie: \u003c/strong\u003eDomino’s invested in new stores and menu items, speedy delivery times, and its online operations. For the entire week of Cyber Monday, it offered half off menu-priced pizzas for online orders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s the opposite of a silver lining? \u003c/strong\u003eFor Domino’s it was international same-store sales growth, which missed estimates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDomino’s is facing a tough market, with newer entrants like DoorDash and UberEats \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/20/dominos-pizza-dpz-earnings-q4-2019-beat-wall-street-estimates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escooping up\u003c/a\u003e impulsive dinner orderers. But Domino’s shares outperformed both McDonald’s and Yum Brands (which owns rival Pizza Hut) in 2019.
